What is the concept of Delegated Proof-of-Stake Consensus, and where can I find more information about it?

Delegated Proof-of-Stake Consensus is a consensus algorithm used in some blockchain networks. It is a variant of the Proof-of-Stake (PoS) algorithm, where users can vote for validators, and the validators with the most votes are chosen to create new blocks. You can find more information about it in the BitShares documentation, specifically in the article "Delegated Proof-of-Stake Consensus" (Reference [11]).
